newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: LITHUANIA - BOURSE ADDS 11 SHARES TO A LIST, REMOVES SIX.
newsitem.headline: LITHUANIA - BOURSE ADDS 11 SHARES TO A LIST, REMOVES SIX.

text.p: Lithuania's bourse said on Monday that it had added 11 new shares to its A group and had removed six from the list.
The head of the bourse's listing department, Saulius Malinauskas, told Reuters that the additions and removals would come into effect on April 28.
The A list tracks the most active shares on the Lithuanian stock exchange.
"The eleven new companies all meet the main requirements for the A list, such as operating profitably last year and having liquid stocks for the past three months," Malinauskas said.

The eleven new A list shares are: Linas, Lietkavelis, Endokriniai Preparatai, Vilniaus Degtine, Gubernija, Marijampoles Pieno Konservai, Klaipeda Sea Caro Company, Vilniaus Pergale, Vilniaus Kailiai, Lithuanian Energy and Stumbras.

The six shares to be removed from the A list are: ordinary shares of Silikatas, privileged shares in Sanitas, ordinary and privileged shares in Vilniaus Grudai, ordinary and privileged shares in Klaipedos Duona.
Malinauskas said that Silkatas had a loss in 1996 while the other five shares were not traded very actively over the past three months.
There are currently 43 shares from 37 companies traded on the A list.
From April 28, there will be 48 shares from 44 companies on the A list.
